intro: Bupleurum gramineum subsp. cernuum, commonly known as the nodding bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in loose panicles, often drooping downward, giving it its common name. Its leaves are lance-shaped and alternate, with a slightly hairy surface. This species is often found in open woodland, grasslands, and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
